issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

components.name: Titanium SDK & CLI
components.description: Please enter tickets related to the MobileSDK here.

fields.description:
Description:
If you download the image and save it to you gallery it is turned by 90° and also if you display it in an imageview. If you display the exact same image in a webview, it won't be turned. This only appears with image taken with the frontside camera.

How to reproduce:
Upload an image, taken with the frontside camera and upload it to GAE (we use Google App Engine's Images API).
fields.summary: Pictures taken with the front camera on iPhone 4 are turned 90°
fields.environment:
iOS 4.3.1 - 4.3.3, iPhone 4, iPhone 3GS, iPad 1, iPad 2
Ti: 1.6.2, 1.7.0

comments.body:
In order for us to progress this issue, edit your ticket to include a proper [Use-case|http://wiki.appcelerator.org/display/guides/Contributing+to+Titanium#ContributingtoTitanium-CreatingGoodUsecases].

Please read the [Submitting Bug Reports|http://wiki.appcelerator.org/display/guides/Contributing+to+Titanium#ContributingtoTitanium-SubmittingBugReports] guide before raising tickets.

Thank you
No response from user after request for information. Marking resolved / incomplete.
